elevator

Class Elevator

  • java.lang.Object
    • elevator.Elevator

  • public class Elevator
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents an Elevator Object. This class controls the behavior of the elevator and contains an ElevatorStack object to organize the people in the elevator and another stack to represent people who temporarily exit the elevator.
    Author:
    Wesley Chan

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • getCurrentFloor

        public int getCurrentFloor()
        Gets the current floor the elevator is on
        Returns:
        currentFloor is the floor the elevator is currently on as type int

      • setDestinationFloor

        public void setDestinationFloor(int floor)
        Sets the Destination floor
        Parameters:
        floor - this is the floor that the elevator wants to go to next

      • setRequestedFloor

        public void setRequestedFloor(int floor)
        Sets the requested floor
        Parameters:
        floor - this is a floor that a person has pressed a button on or wants to go to

      • getElevStack

        public ElevatorStack getElevStack()

      • switchElevDirection

        public void switchElevDirection()
        Switches direction elevator is moving. -1 corresponds to downward, 1 is upward

      • enter

        public void enter(ElevatorPerson ep)
        Method that signifies a person entering the elevator. Person will be pushed onto the elevator stack.
        Parameters:
        ep - ElevavatorPerson object that represents someone entering the elevator

      • exit

        public void exit()
          throws java.io.IOException
        Permanently pops people from the Elevator Stack if it is their exit floor. This method will pop people to a temporary stack if needed. This represents people getting out of the elevator so that the people who need to exit can get out. Then the people who temporarily exited will get back on. Postcondition: tempExitStack will be empty after method call completes
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the output file cannot be found

      • calcNextFloor

        public void calcNextFloor()
        Determines which floor is the next closest floor based on the direction the elevator is moving. This floor can either be from someone exiting or entering. If there are no floor requests in the direction the elevator is moving, the elevator will switch it's direction.

      • moveElev

        public void moveElev()
              throws java.io.IOException
        This method moves the elevator to the destination floor and records the movement. It will record if the elevator is moving while there are no passengers.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if it cannot find the file to write to

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()

      • isFull

        public boolean isFull()
